Package com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection

Class HookDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.guardsquare.dexguard.runtime.detection.HookDetector
  • public class HookDetector
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a utility method to detect hooks in the runtime environment of the application, with frameworks like Frida.

    Once successful, hooking frameworks have complete control over the app. The user or the controlling code could thus subvert the intended functionality of the app.

    Hooking frameworks often try to hide the fact that an app is hooked, so hook detection is necessarily based on a series of heuristics. These heuristics can result in false positives and false negatives:

    • False negatives: the detector may fail to flag that an app is hooked, if the hooking framework is successfully hiding itself.
    • False positives: the detector may flag an app that is hooked but not exploited.

    HookDetector is tested with a number of frameworks, such as Frida, CydiaSubstrate, Xposed, Magisk, XHook, ADBI, etc.

    For checking the integrity of your apk file and its contents, you should consider the reliable TamperDetector and CertificateChecker. These detectors complement and protect the other checks well.

    If the constraints of your app allow it, you should consider Google's SafetyNet API, which provides more elaborate checks backed by on-line servers.

    Performance consideration:: you should ideally not call this detector on the UI thread or in performance-sensitive parts of the application.

      • FAST

        public static final int FAST
        Use this flag for faster hook detection. It makes the HookDetector use faster versions of some of the time consuming checks.

    • Method Detail

      • isApplicationHooked

        public static int isApplicationHooked​(android.content.Context context)
        Checks whether the Android runtime environment of the application has been hooked.
        Parameters:
        context - the application's context.
        Returns:
        0 if not hooked.

      • isApplicationHooked

        public static int isApplicationHooked​(android.content.Context context,
                                      int ok)
        Checks whether the Android runtime environment of the application has been hooked.
        Parameters:
        context - the application's context.
        ok - a return value that can be chosen freely.
        Returns:
        ok if not hooked.

      • isApplicationHooked

        public static int isApplicationHooked​(android.content.Context context,
                                      int ok,
                                      int flags)
        Checks whether the Android runtime environment of the application has been hooked.
        Parameters:
        context - the application's context.
        ok - a return value that can be chosen freely.
        flags - faster hook detection if the FAST flag is used.
        Returns:
        ok if not hooked.

      • isApplicationHookedInternal

        public static HookDetectorReport isApplicationHookedInternal​(int ok,
                                                             int flags)
        Checks whether the Android runtime environment of the application has been hooked.
        Parameters:
        ok - a return value that can be chosen freely.
        Returns:
        a HookDetectorReport containing info about the detected threat.
